module com.gitlab.ci.schema.pipeline

Module that provides the gitlab-ci schema itself (.gitlab-ci.yml)

Module URI:
package://opensource.aoe.com/pkl-pantry/packages/com.gitlab.ci.schema@0.1.0#/pipeline.pklcontent_copy

    hidden
    output: ModuleOutput (pkl.base)Source

    The output of this module.

    Defaults to all module properties rendered as either Pcf or the format specified on the command line.

  • link
    hidden
    inputs: Typed?Source

    Job inputs as hidden field to allow to reuse default for jobs and services

  • link
    include: Includes?Source

    Can be IncludeItem or IncludeItem[]. Each IncludeItem will be a string, or an object with properties for the method if including external YAML file. The external content will be fetched, included and evaluated along the .gitlab-ci.yml. Learn More.",

  • link
    image: ContainerImageName|Image|NullSource

    Specifies the docker image to use for the job or globally for all jobs. Job configuration takes precedence over global setting. Requires a certain kind of Gitlab runner executor. Learn More.

  • link
    services: Listing<(ContainerImageName|AbstractService)>Source

    Similar to image property, but will link the specified services to the image container. Learn More.

  • link
    before_script: Script?Source

    Defines scripts that should run before the job. Can be set globally or per job. Learn More.

  • link
    after_script: Script?Source

    Defines scripts that should run after the job. Can be set globally or per job. Learn More.

  • link
    variables: GlobalVariables?Source

    Defines default variables for all jobs. Job level property overrides global variables. Learn More.",

  • link
    cache: Cache?Source

    Defining cache globally is deprecated. Use default instead. Learn more.

  • link
    stages: Listing<(String|Listing<String>(!isEmpty && isDistinct))>(!isEmpty && isDistinct)Source

    Groups jobs into stages. All jobs in one stage must complete before next stage is executed. Defaults to 'build', 'test', 'deploy'. Learn More.

  • link
    default: Default?Source

    Global job defaults

  • link
    pages: AbstractJob?Source

    A special job used to upload static sites to Gitlab pages. Requires a public/ directory with artifacts.path pointing to it. Learn More.

  • link
    hidden
    jobs: Mapping<String, AbstractJob>Source

    A list of Jobs. The gitlab-ci jsonschema does not know this property, but it is required for PKL. Every job will be added to the output as top-level map to follow gitlabs jsonschema

    ifNonNull<Result>(transform: (NonNull) -> Result): Result? (pkl.base)Source

    Returns this |> transform if this is non-null, and null otherwise.

    This method is the complement of the ?? operator and the equivalent of an Option type's map and flatMap methods.

  • expand_morelink
    function
    relativePathTo(other: Module): List<String> (pkl.base)Source

    Returns the relative, descendent directory path between this module and other.

    Throws if no such path exists.

    For example, if module mod1 has path /dir1/mod1.pkl, and module mod2 has path /dir1/dir2/dir3/mod2.pkl, then mod1.relativePathTo(mod2) will return List("dir2", "dir3").

    A common use case is to compute the directory path between a template located at the root of a hierarchy (say rootModule.pkl) and the currently evaluated module (accessible via the module keyword):

    import "rootModule.pkl" // self-import
path = rootModule.relativePathTo(module)
